summary: the fast-casual chain will work with the postmates app to begin offering delivery for online and mobile orders in 67 cities . but mexican food fans should know that the restaurant plans to add a nine per cent service charge . chipotle is thought to have turned down previous offers of collaboration with third-party delivery services - but has now given postmates the green light , new york daily news reports .

aspect: 1. Chipotle has teamed up with Postmates to deliver burritos to customers' doors.
2. Chipotle has added a nine per cent service charge for delivery fees, with Postmates fees starting at $5.
3. Chipotle has turned down previous offers of collaboration with delivery services but has now agreed to work with Postmates.
4. Chipotle has gone from strength to strength and has been visited by presidential candidates Marco Rubio and Hillary Clinton.
5. Chipotle is not the only franchise hoping to cash in on the delivery market, with Starbucks, Taco Bell, McDonald's, and Burger King also exploring the option.
explain: Chipotle Mexican Grill has partnered with Postmates, a delivery service app, to begin offering delivery for online and mobile orders in 67 cities.

Chipotle has added a nine per cent service charge for delivery fees, with Postmates fees starting at $5. 
The core idea is that for their delivery services, Chipotle has added a nine percent service charge in addition to the fees charged by Postmates, with Postmates fees starting at $5. This means that customers will have to pay more for the convenience of having their food delivered to them.
Chipotle had previously rejected offers by third-party delivery services to collaborate, but has now agreed to partner with Postmates.
Chipotle's popularity makes it a popular destination for presidential candidates looking to win over voters.

The given aspect highlights that fast-casual chain Chipotle is not the only franchise that wants a piece of the delivery market. Starbucks, Taco Bell, McDonald's, and Burger King are also exploring the option of delivery service. This indicates that delivery services are becoming increasingly popular among various fast-food chains.
answer: Chipotle Mexican Grill has partnered with Postmates, a delivery service app, to begin offering delivery for online and mobile orders in 67 cities. Additionally, the fast-casual chain plans to add a nine per cent service charge for Mexican food fans, according to the New York Daily News.
